New Records: Chourio moved closer to becoming the youngest player in Major League history to log a 20/20 season
Key Match Events: Chourio hit a go-ahead, ninth-inning home run
Bauers made a game-ending defensive gem in the bottom of the ninth
Perkins robbed another home run to preserve a 4-4 tie in the sixth
Pre-Game Insights: The question was whether Chourio's ankle was good, or just 'good enough'
Manager Pat Murphy said, 'I'm not as surprised. The first time you do an ankle like that... the first time you do it, it probably freaked him out.'
Post-Match Reflections: Chourio said, 'I think it's getting pretty freaking ridiculous, to be completely honest. This kid is special, for sure.'
Murphy said, 'He's still learning the finer points of the game, but you donâ€™t need to tell him too much.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers earned their 80th win of the season
The Brewers are 10 games up on the Cubs in the National League Central standings
Chourio would be the third player to accomplish a 20/20 season, and the other two players, Vada Pinson and Mike Trout, turned 21 along the way
